meanings.definition: The series of vertebrae extending from the skull to the pelvis, supporting the body and protecting the spinal cord.
meanings.sent1: A strong backbone is essential for good posture.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how important it is to take care of your backbone.
meanings.sent3: When the comedian joked about having a rubber backbone, the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her backbone of steel helped her endure the toughest challenges.
meanings.sent5: The backbone is like a sturdy pillar holding up the entire body.

meanings.definition: The chief support or mainstay of something.
meanings.sent1: Trust is the backbone of any healthy relationship.
meanings.sent2: Education is often seen as the backbone of a successful society.
meanings.sent3: The backbone of the plan was the innovative technology they had developed.
meanings.sent4: Her unwavering support was the backbone of the team's success.
meanings.sent5: Communication is the backbone that keeps a team working smoothly.

meanings.definition: Courage and resolve; strength of character.
meanings.sent1: She showed incredible backbone in standing up for what she believed in.
meanings.sent2: The soldier's backbone never wavered in the face of danger.
meanings.sent3: His backbone shone through when he faced his fears head-on.
meanings.sent4: The backbone of the leader inspired the team to overcome any obstacle.
meanings.sent5: Courage is the backbone that propels us forward in challenging times.
